snippet: Two dueling realities — an improving economy that remains very weak — create serious political risks for top advisers to President Obama and Mitt Romney.
abstract: Labor Department reports that the unemployment rate fell to 8.3 percent in January, from a high of 10 percent in late 2009, returning to the level of Pres Obama's first full month in office; the burst of job growth gives Pres Obama a fresh opportunity to revise the grim economic narrative of his presidency, while offering Mitt Romney a choice between embracing a new optimism or campaigning against a sinking economy even as it shows signs of turning around.

byline.contributor: Jonathan Weisman and Mark Landler contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Two dueling realities — an improving economy that remains very weak — create serious political risks for top advisers to President Obama and Mitt Romney.

headline.seo: Jobless Rate Falls to 8.3%, Altering Face of Campaign
headline.main: Jobless Rate Falls to 8.3%, Altering Face of Campaign
headline.print_headline: Jobless Rate Falls to 8.3%, Altering Face of Campaign
